text: You mean you do not sync those files at all? We could not edit the content of the module when we removed those files.
Do you have this setting turned off?

*Version Update | v0.0.25*
What's changed?
1. Rename command to `hs` from `hscms`
2. Add support for `.hsignore` file that will ignore files from being uploaded when using `hs upload` and `hs watch`
3. Added support for `.yaml` extension for the config file
4. Improved module `create` command so that by default css and js donâ€™t result in network requests for a file that only has comments

Run `npm install -g @HubSpot/cms-cli@latest` to update your version and get access to these new features!

Additionally supported in this version is uploading additional file types to the Design Manager, like images and font files, so they can be collocated in your file project. Being part of this beta functionality requires some additional steps, and is currently only being granted access to CMS Developer Sandbox portals, but see <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CCGU4R4ER/p1569523983024800> for more details on how to get access!

I have a question about `npx hscms upload`.

If `css_assets` is set in `meta.json` of Custom Module,
When uploading, the following error occurs.

```
[ERROR] Uploading file "/Users/xxx/Sample Project/Custom_Modules/Sample.module/meta.json" to "Sample Project/Custom_Modules/Sample.module/meta.json" failed
[ERROR] No asset exists at path /Sample Project/Custom_Modules/Sample.module/Sample Project/Coded_Files/style.css. Has the file been synced?
```

`Sample Project/Custom_Modules/Sample.module/meta.json`
```
...
  "css_assets" : [ {
    "name" : "style.css",
    "autoload" : true,
    "path" : "Sample Project/Coded_Files/style.css"
  } ],
...
```

The `Sample Project` uses what has been `npx hscms fetch`.

```
$ npx hscms -V
0.0.25
```

Do you understand the cause?
